title: Change in KE for Fe and Al

content.question:
Substance
 Specific Heat <math alttext="(in joules per gram degrees Celsius)" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>J/</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle><mo>⋅</mo><mo>⁢</mo><mmultiscripts><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle><mprescripts></mprescripts><none></none><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></mmultiscripts><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 Mass of Sample <math alttext="(in grams)" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>g</mi></mstyle><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F e, solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>F</mi><mi>e</mi></mstyle><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="0.46" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.46</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="1.0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="A l, solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>A</mi><mi>l</mi></mstyle><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="0.91" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.91</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="1.0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Samples of <math alttext="F e" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>F</mi><mi>e</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="A l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are heated from <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>C</mi></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="75 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>75</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on the information in the table above, the change in the average kinetic energy of the atoms in the samples is

choices.label: higher for the <math alttext="F e" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>F</mi><mi>e</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> sample, because with its lower specific heat it absorbs more energy

higher for the <math alttext="A l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> sample, because with its higher specific heat it absorbs more energy
the same for both metal samples, because the initial and final temperatures are the same
the same for both metal samples, because the masses are equal

content.answer: the same for both metal samples, because the initial and final temperatures are the same

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
